meanings.definition: The interpretation of words in their usual or most basic sense.
meanings.sent1: His literalism made it easy for him to understand the story.
meanings.sent2: Her literalism helped her grasp the meaning of the poem quickly.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's literalism led to some unintentional humor in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The literalism of the instructions made it impossible to misinterpret them.
meanings.sent5: The literalism of his speech made it clear that he meant exactly what he said.

meanings.definition: Adherence to the exact words of a text.
meanings.sent1: The student's literalism in following the recipe resulted in a delicious cake.
meanings.sent2: His literalism in quoting the passage impressed the professor.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer's literalism in the contract negotiation made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her literalism in copying the document word for word saved her from mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The literalism of the musician in playing the notes precisely was admirable.

meanings.definition: The belief that the words of a text should be taken at face value.
meanings.sent1: Their literalism in accepting the story as true showed their gullibility.
meanings.sent2: The literalism of the followers in interpreting the scripture caused controversy.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's literalism in his jokes made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The literalism of the warning sign saved many from danger.
meanings.sent5: The literalism of her promise reassured him of her sincerity.
